title: Managing Shared Inboxes in Hiver
content:
Shared inboxes are the foundation of team collaboration in Hiver. Here's how to manage them effectively:

Setting Up a Shared Inbox:
1. Go to Settings > Shared Mailboxes
2. Click 'Add Shared Mailbox'
3. Enter the email address (e.g., support@company.com)
4. Grant Gmail access permissions
5. Configure mailbox settings

Key Features:

1. Email Assignment:
   - Assign emails to specific team members
   - See who's working on what at a glance
   - Prevent duplicate responses

2. Email Status:
   - Open: New, unassigned emails
   - Pending: Awaiting response or action
   - Closed: Resolved conversations
   - Custom statuses available on higher plans

3. Collaboration:
   - Add internal notes (invisible to customers)
   - @mention team members for input
   - Share drafts for review before sending

4. Organization:
   - Use tags to categorize emails
   - Create custom views and filters
   - Set up folders for different workflows

5. Team Management:
   - Add or remove team members
   - Set permissions (Admin, Member, Light user)
   - Configure notification preferences

Best Practices:
- Establish clear assignment protocols
- Use tags consistently across the team
- Regularly close resolved conversations
- Set up automations for common scenarios
- Review analytics to identify bottlenecks

Common Issues:
- Emails not syncing: Check Gmail permissions
- Missing emails: Verify filters and archive settings
- Duplicate notifications: Adjust notification settings per user
